medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 3 months earlier, worsened during the past 3 weeks. Nausea and vomiting occurred in the early morning, abated later in the day, and were exacerbated by stress. The patient reported fatigue and an intermittent sensation of regurgitation and burning in the throat. Treatment with lansoprazole was initiated 5 days prior with no decrease in symptoms.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) treated in infancy, admitted for bronchiolitis at 15 months, history of recurrent episodes of vomiting, and previous evaluation by a pediatric gastroenterologist at age 5. Also had hypertension evaluated at age 6. Diagnosis of a Salterâ€“Harris type 2 fracture at age 10.
medical_history.family_history: Father has type 1 diabetes mellitus and hypertension; paternal uncle has hypothyroidism.
medical_history.social_history: Lives with parents and twin sister in a suburban area. Academically performs well in school and participates in sports. Recently studied intensively for a private-school entrance examination.
